newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico accepts private bids for Ensenada port.
newsitem.headline: Mexico accepts private bids for Ensenada port.

text.p: Mexico's Communications and Transport Ministry said Thursday it accepted bids for private operation of the port of Ensenada from four consortia.

Ensenada is a multi-use, commercial, fishing and tourist port on the northwestern tip of the Baja California peninsula. It ranked second in the country in cruise tourist traffic and sixth in cargo traffic in 1993.
The ministry said the bidders were:
-- Transportacion Maritima Mexicana (TMM), Servicios en Puertos y Terminales and Operadora Portuaria de Ensenada.
-- Internacional de Contenedores Asociados de Veracruz.
The concession is for 20 years, with the possibility of renewal, the ministry said.
Ensenada port includes a surface 144,228.91 square meters, including 72,266.37 square meters federal zone.
